nested_items.name: id
nested_items.description: The unique ID for the build.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the build.

nested_items.name: buildNumber
nested_items.description: The number of the build. For each project, the buildNumber of its first build is 1. The buildNumber of each subsequent build is incremented by 1. If a build is deleted, the buildNumber of other builds does not change.

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: When the build process started, expressed in Unix time format.

nested_items.name: endTime
nested_items.description: When the build process ended, expressed in Unix time format.

nested_items.name: currentPhase
nested_items.description: The current build phase.

nested_items.name: buildStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the build. Valid values include:
FAILED: The build failed.
FAULT: The build faulted.
IN_PROGRESS: The build is still in progress.
STOPPED: The build stopped.
SUCCEEDED: The build succeeded.
TIMED_OUT: The build timed out.

nested_items.name: sourceVersion
nested_items.description: Any version identifier for the version of the source code to be built. If sourceVersion is specified at the project level, then this sourceVersion (at the build level) takes precedence.

nested_items.name: resolvedSourceVersion
nested_items.description: An identifier for the version of this build's source code.
For CodeCommit, GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, and BitBucket, the commit ID.
For CodePipeline, the source revision provided by CodePipeline.
For Amazon S3, this does not apply.

nested_items.name: projectName
nested_items.description: The name of the CodeBuild project.

nested_items.name: phases
nested_items.description: Information about all previous build phases that are complete and information about any current build phase that is not yet complete.

nested_items.name: phaseType
nested_items.description: The name of the build phase. Valid values include:

nested_items.name: phaseStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the build phase. Valid values include:

nested_items.name: startTime
nested_items.description: When the build phase started, expressed in Unix time format.

nested_items.name: endTime
nested_items.description: When the build phase ended, expressed in Unix time format.

nested_items.name: durationInSeconds
nested_items.description: How long, in seconds, between the starting and ending times of the build's phase.

nested_items.name: contexts
nested_items.description: Additional information about a build phase, especially to help troubleshoot a failed build.

nested_items.name: statusCode
nested_items.description: The status code for the context of the build phase.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: An explanation of the build phase's context. This might include a command ID and an exit code.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of repository that contains the source code to be built. Valid values include:
BITBUCKET: The source code is in a Bitbucket repository.
CODECOMMIT: The source code is in an CodeCommit repository.
CODEPIPELINE: The source code settings are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline.
GITHUB: The source code is in a GitHub repository.
GITHUB_ENTERPRISE: The source code is in a GitHub Enterprise Server repository.
GITLAB: The source code is in a GitLab repository.
GITLAB_SELF_MANAGED: The source code is in a self-managed GitLab repository.
NO_SOURCE: The project does not have input source code.
S3: The source code is in an Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of the source code to be built. Valid values include:

For source code settings that are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline, location should not be specified. If it is specified, CodePipeline ignores it. This is because CodePipeline uses the settings in a pipeline's source action instead of this value.

For source code in an CodeCommit repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source code and the buildspec file (for example, https://git-codecommit.<region-ID>.amazonaws.com/v1/repos/<repo-name>).
For source code in an Amazon S3 input bucket, one of the following.
The path to the ZIP file that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path>/<object-name>.zip).
The path to the folder that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path-to-source-code>/<folder>/).

nested_items.name: gitCloneDepth
nested_items.description: Information about the Git clone depth for the build project.

nested_items.name: gitSubmodulesConfig
nested_items.description: Information about the Git submodules configuration for the build project.

nested_items.name: fetchSubmodules
nested_items.description: Set to true to fetch Git submodules for your CodeBuild build project.

nested_items.name: buildspec
nested_items.description: The buildspec file declaration to use for the builds in this build project.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The authorization type to use. Valid options are OAUTH, CODECONNECTIONS, or SECRETS_MANAGER.

nested_items.name: resource
nested_items.description: The resource value that applies to the specified authorization type.

nested_items.name: reportBuildStatus
nested_items.description: Set to true to report the status of a build's start and finish to your source provider. This option is valid only when your source provider is GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, GitLab, GitLab Self Managed, GitLab, GitLab Self Managed, or Bitbucket. If this is set and you use a different source provider, an invalidInputException is thrown.

nested_items.name: buildStatusConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information that defines how the build project reports the build status to the source provider. This option is only used when the source provider is GITHUB, GITHUB_ENTERPRISE, or BITBUCKET.

nested_items.name: context
nested_items.description: Specifies the context of the build status CodeBuild sends to the source provider. The usage of this parameter depends on the source provider.

nested_items.name: targetUrl
nested_items.description: Specifies the target url of the build status CodeBuild sends to the source provider. The usage of this parameter depends on the source provider.

nested_items.name: insecureSsl
nested_items.description: Enable this flag to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code.

nested_items.name: sourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for this project source. The identifier can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores, and must be less than 128 characters in length.

nested_items.name: secondarySources
nested_items.description: An array of ProjectSource objects.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of repository that contains the source code to be built. Valid values include:
BITBUCKET: The source code is in a Bitbucket repository.
CODECOMMIT: The source code is in an CodeCommit repository.
CODEPIPELINE: The source code settings are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline.
GITHUB: The source code is in a GitHub repository.
GITHUB_ENTERPRISE: The source code is in a GitHub Enterprise Server repository.
GITLAB: The source code is in a GitLab repository.
GITLAB_SELF_MANAGED: The source code is in a self-managed GitLab repository.
NO_SOURCE: The project does not have input source code.
S3: The source code is in an Amazon S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of the source code to be built. Valid values include:

For source code settings that are specified in the source action of a pipeline in CodePipeline, location should not be specified. If it is specified, CodePipeline ignores it. This is because CodePipeline uses the settings in a pipeline's source action instead of this value.

For source code in an CodeCommit repository, the HTTPS clone URL to the repository that contains the source code and the buildspec file (for example, https://git-codecommit.<region-ID>.amazonaws.com/v1/repos/<repo-name>).
For source code in an Amazon S3 input bucket, one of the following.
The path to the ZIP file that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path>/<object-name>.zip).
The path to the folder that contains the source code (for example, <bucket-name>/<path-to-source-code>/<folder>/).

nested_items.name: gitCloneDepth
nested_items.description: Information about the Git clone depth for the build project.

nested_items.name: gitSubmodulesConfig
nested_items.description: Information about the Git submodules configuration for the build project.

nested_items.name: fetchSubmodules
nested_items.description: Set to true to fetch Git submodules for your CodeBuild build project.

nested_items.name: buildspec
nested_items.description: The buildspec file declaration to use for the builds in this build project.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The authorization type to use. Valid options are OAUTH, CODECONNECTIONS, or SECRETS_MANAGER.

nested_items.name: resource
nested_items.description: The resource value that applies to the specified authorization type.

nested_items.name: reportBuildStatus
nested_items.description: Set to true to report the status of a build's start and finish to your source provider. This option is valid only when your source provider is GitHub, GitHub Enterprise, GitLab, GitLab Self Managed, GitLab, GitLab Self Managed, or Bitbucket. If this is set and you use a different source provider, an invalidInputException is thrown.

nested_items.name: buildStatusConfig
nested_items.description: Contains information that defines how the build project reports the build status to the source provider. This option is only used when the source provider is GITHUB, GITHUB_ENTERPRISE, or BITBUCKET.

nested_items.name: context
nested_items.description: Specifies the context of the build status CodeBuild sends to the source provider. The usage of this parameter depends on the source provider.

nested_items.name: targetUrl
nested_items.description: Specifies the target url of the build status CodeBuild sends to the source provider. The usage of this parameter depends on the source provider.

nested_items.name: insecureSsl
nested_items.description: Enable this flag to ignore SSL warnings while connecting to the project source code.

nested_items.name: sourceIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for this project source. The identifier can only contain alphanumeric characters and underscores, and must be less than 128 characters in length.

nested_items.name: secondarySourceVersions
nested_items.description: An array of ProjectSourceVersion objects. Each ProjectSourceVersion must be one of:
For CodeCommit: the commit ID, branch, or Git tag to use.

For GitHub: the commit ID, pull request ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a pull request ID is specified, it must use the format pr/pull-request-ID (for example, pr/25). If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.

For Bitbucket: the commit ID, branch name, or tag name that corresponds to the version of the source code you want to build. If a branch name is specified, the branch's HEAD commit ID is used. If not specified, the default branch's HEAD commit ID is used.
For Amazon S3: the version ID of the object that represents the build input ZIP file to use.

nested_items.name: artifacts
nested_items.description: Information about the output artifacts for the build.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of the build artifacts.

nested_items.name: sha256sum
nested_items.description: The SHA-256 hash of the build artifact.

nested_items.name: md5sum
nested_items.description: The MD5 hash of the build artifact.

nested_items.name: overrideArtifactName
nested_items.description: If this flag is set, a name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name. The name specified in a buildspec file is calculated at build time and uses the Shell Command Language. For example, you can append a date and time to your artifact name so that it is always unique.

nested_items.name: encryptionDisabled
nested_items.description: Information that tells you if encryption for build artifacts is disabled.

nested_items.name: artifactIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for this artifact definition.

nested_items.name: bucketOwnerAccess
nested_items.description: Specifies the bucket owner's access for objects that another account uploads to their Amazon S3 bucket. By default, only the account that uploads the objects to the bucket has access to these objects. This property allows you to give the bucket owner access to these objects.
Otherwise, the uploading account retains ownership of the objects.

nested_items.name: secondaryArtifacts
nested_items.description: An array of ProjectArtifacts objects.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: Information about the location of the build artifacts.

nested_items.name: sha256sum
nested_items.description: The SHA-256 hash of the build artifact.

nested_items.name: md5sum
nested_items.description: The MD5 hash of the build artifact.

nested_items.name: overrideArtifactName
nested_items.description: If this flag is set, a name specified in the buildspec file overrides the artifact name. The name specified in a buildspec file is calculated at build time and uses the Shell Command Language. For example, you can append a date and time to your artifact name so that it is always unique.

nested_items.name: encryptionDisabled
nested_items.description: Information that tells you if encryption for build artifacts is disabled.

nested_items.name: artifactIdentifier
nested_items.description: An identifier for this artifact definition.

nested_items.name: bucketOwnerAccess
nested_items.description: Specifies the bucket owner's access for objects that another account uploads to their Amazon S3 bucket. By default, only the account that uploads the objects to the bucket has access to these objects. This property allows you to give the bucket owner access to these objects.
Otherwise, the uploading account retains ownership of the objects.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of cache used by the build project. Valid values include:
NO_CACHE: The build project does not use any cache.
S3: The build project reads and writes from and to S3.
LOCAL: The build project stores a cache locally on a build host that is only available to that build host.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: Information about the cache location:
NO_CACHE or LOCAL: This value is ignored.
S3: This is the S3 bucket name/prefix.

nested_items.name: modes
nested_items.description: An array of strings that specify the local cache modes. You can use one or more local cache modes at the same time. This is only used for LOCAL cache types.
Only directories can be specified for caching. You cannot specify individual files.
Symlinks are used to reference cached directories.

Cached directories are linked to your build before it downloads its project sources. Cached items are overridden if a source item has the same name. Directories are specified using cache paths in the buildspec file.

nested_items.name: cacheNamespace
nested_items.description: Defines the scope of the cache. You can use this namespace to share a cache across multiple projects. For more information, see Cache sharing between projects in the CodeBuild User Guide.

nested_items.name: environment
nested_items.description: Information about the build environment for this build.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of build environment to use for related builds.

nested_items.name: image
nested_items.description: The image tag or image digest that identifies the Docker image to use for this build project. Use the following formats:
For an image tag: <registry>/<repository>:<tag>. For example, in the Docker repository that CodeBuild uses to manage its Docker images, this would be aws/codebuild/standard:4.0.

For an image digest: <registry>/<repository>@<digest>. For example, to specify an image with the digest 'sha256:cbbf2f9a99b47fc460d422812b6a5adff7dfee951d8fa2e4a98caa0382cfbdbf,' use <registry>/<repository>@sha256:cbbf2f9a99b47fc460d422812b6a5adff7dfee951d8fa2e4a98caa0382cfbdbf.

nested_items.name: computeType
nested_items.description: Information about the compute resources the build project uses. Available values include:
ATTRIBUTE_BASED_COMPUTE: Specify the amount of vCPUs, memory, disk space, and the type of machine.

nested_items.name: computeConfiguration
nested_items.description: The compute configuration of the build project. This is only required if computeType is set to ATTRIBUTE_BASED_COMPUTE.

nested_items.name: vCpu
nested_items.description: The number of vCPUs of the instance type included in your fleet.

nested_items.name: memory
nested_items.description: The amount of memory of the instance type included in your fleet.

nested_items.name: disk
nested_items.description: The amount of disk space of the instance type included in your fleet.

nested_items.name: machineType
nested_items.description: The machine type of the instance type included in your fleet.

nested_items.name: instanceType
nested_items.description: The EC2 instance type to be launched in your fleet.

nested_items.name: fleetArn
nested_items.description: Specifies the compute fleet ARN for the build project.

nested_items.name: environmentVariables
nested_items.description: A set of environment variables to make available to builds for this build project.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name or key of the environment variable.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value of the environment variable.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of environment variable. Valid values include:

PARAMETER_STORE: An environment variable stored in Systems Manager Parameter Store. For environment variables of this type, specify the name of the parameter as the value of the EnvironmentVariable. The parameter value will be substituted for the name at runtime. You can also define Parameter Store environment variables in the buildspec. To learn how to do so, see env/parameter-store in the CodeBuild User Guide.
PLAINTEXT: An environment variable in plain text format. This is the default value.

SECRETS_MANAGER: An environment variable stored in Secrets Manager. For environment variables of this type, specify the name of the secret as the value of the EnvironmentVariable. The secret value will be substituted for the name at runtime. You can also define Secrets Manager environment variables in the buildspec. To learn how to do so, see env/secrets-manager in the CodeBuild User Guide.

nested_items.name: privilegedMode
nested_items.description: Enables running the Docker daemon inside a Docker container. Set to true only if the build project is used to build Docker images. Otherwise, a build that attempts to interact with the Docker daemon fails. The default setting is false.

nested_items.name: certificate
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Amazon S3 bucket, path prefix, and object key that contains the PEM-encoded certificate for the build project. For more information, see certificate in the CodeBuild User Guide.

nested_items.name: registryCredential
nested_items.description: The credentials for access to a private registry.

nested_items.name: credential
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or name of credentials created using Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: credentialProvider
nested_items.description: The service that created the credentials to access a private Docker registry. The valid value, SECRETS_MANAGER, is for Secrets Manager.

nested_items.name: imagePullCredentialsType
nested_items.description: The type of credentials CodeBuild uses to pull images in your build. There are two valid values:
CODEBUILD specifies that CodeBuild uses its own credentials. This requires that you modify your ECR repository policy to trust CodeBuild service principal.
SERVICE_ROLE specifies that CodeBuild uses your build project's service role.

nested_items.name: serviceRole
nested_items.description: The name of a service role used for this build.

nested_items.name: groupName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs group for the build logs.

nested_items.name: streamName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs stream for the build logs.

nested_items.name: deepLink
nested_items.description: The URL to an individual build log in CloudWatch Logs. The log stream is created during the PROVISIONING phase of a build and the deeplink will not be valid until it is created.

nested_items.name: s3DeepLink
nested_items.description: The URL to a build log in an S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: cloudWatchLogsArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the CloudWatch Logs stream for a build execution. Its format is arn:${Partition}:logs:${Region}:${Account}:log-group:${LogGroupName}:log-stream:${LogStreamName}. The CloudWatch Logs stream is created during the PROVISIONING phase of a build and the ARN will not be valid until it is created. For more information, see Resources Defined by CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: s3LogsArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of S3 logs for a build project. Its format is arn:${Partition}:s3:::${BucketName}/${ObjectName}. For more information, see Resources Defined by Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: cloudWatchLogs
nested_items.description: Information about CloudWatch Logs for a build project.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the logs in CloudWatch Logs for a build project. Valid values are:
ENABLED: CloudWatch Logs are enabled for this build project.
DISABLED: CloudWatch Logs are not enabled for this build project.

nested_items.name: groupName
nested_items.description: The group name of the logs in CloudWatch Logs. For more information, see Working with Log Groups and Log Streams.

nested_items.name: streamName
nested_items.description: The prefix of the stream name of the CloudWatch Logs. For more information, see Working with Log Groups and Log Streams.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the S3 build logs. Valid values are:
ENABLED: S3 build logs are enabled for this build project.
DISABLED: S3 build logs are not enabled for this build project.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: The ARN of an S3 bucket and the path prefix for S3 logs. If your Amazon S3 bucket name is my-bucket, and your path prefix is build-log, then acceptable formats are my-bucket/build-log or arn:aws:s3:::my-bucket/build-log.

nested_items.name: encryptionDisabled
nested_items.description: Set to true if you do not want your S3 build log output encrypted. By default S3 build logs are encrypted.

nested_items.name: bucketOwnerAccess
nested_items.description: Specifies the bucket owner's access for objects that another account uploads to their Amazon S3 bucket. By default, only the account that uploads the objects to the bucket has access to these objects. This property allows you to give the bucket owner access to these objects.
Otherwise, the uploading account retains ownership of the objects.

nested_items.name: timeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: How long, in minutes, from 5 to 2160 (36 hours), for CodeBuild to wait before timing out this build if it does not get marked as completed.

nested_items.name: queuedTimeoutInMinutes
nested_items.description: The number of minutes a build is allowed to be queued before it times out.

nested_items.name: buildComplete
nested_items.description: Whether the build is complete. True if complete; otherwise, false.

nested_items.name: initiator
nested_items.description: The entity that started the build. Valid values include:
If CodePipeline started the build, the pipeline's name (for example, codepipeline/my-demo-pipeline).
If a user started the build, the user's name (for example, MyUserName).
If the Jenkins plugin for CodeBuild started the build, the string CodeBuild-Jenkins-Plugin.

nested_items.name: vpcConfig
nested_items.description: If your CodeBuild project accesses resources in an Amazon VPC, you provide this parameter that identifies the VPC ID and the list of security group IDs and subnet IDs. The security groups and subnets must belong to the same VPC. You must provide at least one security group and one subnet ID.

nested_items.name: vpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon VPC.

nested_items.name: subnets
nested_items.description: A list of one or more subnet IDs in your Amazon VPC.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: securityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of one or more security groups IDs in your Amazon VPC.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: networkInterface
nested_items.description: Describes a network interface.

nested_items.name: subnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet.

nested_items.name: networkInterfaceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the network interface.

nested_items.name: encryptionKey
nested_items.description: The Key Management Service customer master key (CMK) to be used for encrypting the build output artifacts.

nested_items.name: exportedEnvironmentVariables
nested_items.description: A list of exported environment variables for this build.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the exported environment variable.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: The value assigned to the exported environment variable.

nested_items.name: reportArns
nested_items.description: An array of the ARNs associated with this build's reports.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: fileSystemLocations
nested_items.description: An array of ProjectFileSystemLocation objects for a CodeBuild build project. A ProjectFileSystemLocation object specifies the identifier, location, mountOptions, mountPoint, and type of a file system created using Amazon Elastic File System.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The type of the file system. The one supported type is EFS.

nested_items.name: location
nested_items.description: A string that specifies the location of the file system created by Amazon EFS. Its format is efs-dns-name:/directory-path. You can find the DNS name of file system when you view it in the Amazon EFS console. The directory path is a path to a directory in the file system that CodeBuild mounts. For example, if the DNS name of a file system is fs-abcd1234.efs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com, and its mount directory is my-efs-mount-directory, then the location is fs-abcd1234.efs.us-west-2.amazonaws.com:/my-efs-mount-directory.

nested_items.name: mountPoint
nested_items.description: The location in the container where you mount the file system.

nested_items.name: identifier
nested_items.description: The name used to access a file system created by Amazon EFS. CodeBuild creates an environment variable by appending the identifier in all capital letters to CODEBUILD_. For example, if you specify my_efs for identifier, a new environment variable is create named CODEBUILD_MY_EFS.

nested_items.name: mountOptions
nested_items.description: The mount options for a file system created by Amazon EFS. The default mount options used by CodeBuild are nfsvers=4.1,rsize=1048576,wsize=1048576,hard,timeo=600,retrans=2. For more information, see Recommended NFS Mount Options.

nested_items.name: debugSession
nested_items.description: Contains information about the debug session for this build.

nested_items.name: sessionEnabled
nested_items.description: Specifies if session debugging is enabled for this build.

nested_items.name: sessionTarget
nested_items.description: Contains the identifier of the Session Manager session used for the build. To work with the paused build, you open this session to examine, control, and resume the build.

nested_items.name: buildBatchArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the batch build that this build is a member of, if applicable.

nested_items.name: autoRetryConfig
nested_items.description: Information about the auto-retry configuration for the build.

nested_items.name: autoRetryLimit
nested_items.description: The maximum number of additional automatic retries after a failed build. For example, if the auto-retry limit is set to 2, CodeBuild will call the RetryBuild API to automatically retry your build for up to 2 additional times.

nested_items.name: autoRetryNumber
nested_items.description: The number of times that the build has been retried. The initial build will have an auto-retry number of 0.

nested_items.name: nextAutoRetry
nested_items.description: The build ARN of the auto-retried build triggered by the current build. The next auto-retry will be null for builds that don't trigger an auto-retry.

nested_items.name: previousAutoRetry
nested_items.description: The build ARN of the build that triggered the current auto-retry build. The previous auto-retry will be null for the initial build.
